program main
  use global
  implicit none
  integer :: n, i, a, b, max_color
  type(EdgeType) :: e

  read *, n
  allocate(g(0:n-1))
  do i = 0, n-1
    allocate(g(i)%edges(0)) ! Initialize empty
  end do

  do i = 0, n-2
    read *, a, b
    a = a - 1 ! Convert to 0-based
    b = b - 1
    e = EdgeType(i, b)
    call add_edge(g(a), e)
    e = EdgeType(i, a)
    call add_edge(g(b), e)
  end do

  allocate(ans(0:n-2)) ! ans has n-1 elements, indices 0 to n-2
  ans = 0
  call dfs(0, -1, -1) ! to=0, color=-1, parents=-1

  max_color = maxval(ans)
  print *, max_color
  do i = 0, n-2
    print *, ans(i)
  end do

contains

subroutine add_edge(list, edge)
  type(EdgeList), intent(inout) :: list
  type(EdgeType), intent(in) :: edge
  type(EdgeType), allocatable :: temp(:)
  integer :: n

  if (.not. allocated(list%edges)) then
    allocate(list%edges(1))
    list%edges(1) = edge
  else
    n = size(list%edges)
    allocate(temp(n+1))
    temp(1:n) = list%edges
    temp(n+1) = edge
    call move_alloc(temp, list%edges)
  end if
end subroutine add_edge

recursive subroutine dfs(to, color, parents)
  integer, intent(in) :: to, color, parents
  integer :: k, i
  type(EdgeType) :: e

  k = 1
  do i = 1, size(g(to)%edges) e = g(to)%edges(i) if (e%to == parents) cycle
    if (k == color) k = k + 1
    ans(e%id) = k
    call dfs(e%to, k, to)
    k = k + 1
  end do
end subroutine dfs

end program main
